properties.name: Bijar occurrence, Bijar County, Kurdistan Province, Iran
properties.description:
Bijar occurrence, Bijar County, Kurdistan Province, Iran

Type: 537

Location: Iran

NW-SW-trending line of spatter and cinder cones c. 60km long, situated south of Bijar town. There are 6 major cones up to c.10km in diameter and at the southern end a group of 4 smaller cones c.2-3 km across, associated with which are 2 rhyolite domes....

View on Mindat.org

properties.name: Qa'le Hasan Ali Maars, Kerman County, Kerman Province, Iran
properties.description:
Qa'le Hasan Ali Maars, Kerman County, Kerman Province, Iran

Type: 397

Location: Iran

A group of maar craters clustered around village of Qa'le Hasan Ali, with 2 others lying 10 and 15 km to the NE, were originally thought to have impact origin, but Milton (1977) showed that they are in fact phreatomagmatic. The largest known as Great...

View on Mindat.org
